original: @326b dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: @326b dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal lo //

original: sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the noble Avalokiteśvara, the great being.🔽Tadyathā:

original: tadya th'a / smri ti ma ti ma ti /
analyzed: tadya th'a / smri ti ma ti ma ti /
te dza bidy'a / hu ru me /

original: shu dag nag po la sngags 'di lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod byas te zos na /
analyzed: shu dag nag po la sngags 'di lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod byas te zos na /
translated: If one recites this mantra one hundred and eight times over black śudhā and eats it,

original: gdon mi za bar thos pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar thos pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: one will certainly become a holder of what is heard.

original: thos pa 'dzin pa'i gzungs rdzogs so ////
analyzed: thos pa 'dzin pa'i gzungs rdzogs so ////
translated: The Dhāraṇī of Holding What is Heard is complete.
